sentences.en: He could resist her charm no longer.
sentences.cn: 他再也抗拒不住她的魅力.

sentences.en: He resisted pressure to resign.
sentences.cn: 他顶住压力，没辞职。

sentences.en: He tried to pin me down, but I resisted.
sentences.cn: 他试图制伏我，但我奋力反抗。

sentences.en: He was charged with trying to resist arrest .
sentences.cn: 他被指控企图拒捕。

sentences.en: I cannot resist slipping in a word of advice.
sentences.cn: 我忍不住想插上一句建议。

sentences.en: I couldn't resist peeking in the drawer.
sentences.cn: 我不由得偷看了一下抽屉里面。

sentences.en: I couldn't resist telling him the secret.
sentences.cn: 我忍不住把那个秘密告诉了他.

sentences.en: I don't know how to resist my impulse.
sentences.cn: 我不知道怎样抑制自己的感情冲动.

sentences.en: I was unable to resist laughing.
sentences.cn: 我忍不住笑了.

sentences.en: In her place I wouldn't have been able to resist it.
sentences.cn: 如果我是她就可能抗拒不了。

sentences.en: It is vain to resist.
sentences.cn: 抵抗是没用的.

sentences.en: It took great strength to resist the pressure of the authorities.
sentences.cn: 顶住当局的压力花了很大的劲.

sentences.en: Lack of proper nourishment reduces their power to resist disease.
sentences.cn: 营养不良降低了他们抵抗疾病的能力.

sentences.en: No one [ Nothing ] can resist it.
sentences.cn: 莫之能御.

sentences.en: Officials couldn't resist rubbing it in.
sentences.cn: 官员们忍不住反复讲这件事。

sentences.en: She cannot resist giving him advice.
sentences.cn: 她忍不住给他提建议。

sentences.en: She couldn't resist a dig at Dave after his unfortunate performance.
sentences.cn: 戴夫糟糕的表演结束后，她忍不住想挖苦他一番。

sentences.en: Such euphony is hard to resist.
sentences.cn: 如此的悦耳之声令人难以抵抗.

sentences.en: The bank strongly resisted cutting interest rates.
sentences.cn: 银行强烈反对降低利率。

sentences.en: They only wanted 3 dollars for it, so how could I resist?
sentences.cn: 他们只要3美元，我怎能不买？

sentences.en: to resist change
sentences.cn: 抵制变革

words.tran_cn: 无抵抗力的；无法抗拒的
阻力；电阻；抵抗；反抗；抵抗力
[电] 电阻率；抵抗力；电阻系数

phrases.tran_cn: 人见人爱；无法抗拒；惹人喜爱

trans.tran_en: to try to prevent a change from happening, or prevent yourself from being forced to do something
to use force to stop something from happening
to use force to stop something from happening
